CatDescriptText: Miss Elizabeth Kerr, dental receptionist, 2937 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "Personally, I think that they follow religion and politics.  To me, politics is being followed because the people are straying away from the church. Religion is still first, however, but it is running close to politics for the popularity of the people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Elizabeth Kerr wearing patterned coat, holding small paper bag, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs and Kappels stores in background, Downtown
